he: אמר רב יוסף ניחזי אנן מדתניא בברייתא המוכר עבדו בחו"ל יצא לחירות וצריך גט שיחרור מרבו שני ש"מ מדקרי ליה לשני רבו אלמא לא הדרי זביני וכי קאמר שמואל הכא אינה מכורה ומעות חוזרין
text: Rav Yosef said: Let us see if it is possible to resolve Rav Anan’s dilemma. It may be resolved from that which is taught in a baraita: In the case of one who sells his slave to a Jew outside of Eretz Yisrael, the slave is emancipated but nevertheless requires a bill of manumission from his second master. Conclude from the baraita as follows: Since the baraita calls the second owner the slave’s master, and requires him to emancipate the slave, evidently the sale is not retracted, and the buyer loses his money. And therefore, when Shmuel says here that the field is not sold during the Jubilee Year, he means that the sale does not take effect and the money is returned to the buyer.
